result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DEREK A. DRIER

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM Defendant DEREK A. DRIER in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for DEREK A. DRIER.  Prosecuting attorney Tucker T. Tellefson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution, set for plea/sent 30 days out.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant DEREK A. DRIER in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for DEREK A. DRIER.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy Ann Paider in court for the State of Wisconsin. NG plea entered, set plea/sent 45 days out. Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No alcohol consumption or possession. No contact with V1 or V2 or their residence in WISO report 22-2985. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. Absolute sobriety. Do not be on the premises of any bars or taverns. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.

2:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DEREK A. DRIER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicole A Morley appeared by video for DEREK A. DRIER. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 250
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
